Release 2.0

Merge pull request #144 from sanger-tol/release_2.0_fixes

Release 2.0 fixes
Fix KeyError Exceptions and ensure getting all biosample collectors/identifiers for the author string
Moved sanger specific running instructions to the end of the file
added comments and appropriate error raising
Merge branch 'release_2.0_fixes' of github.com:sanger-tol/genomenote into release_2.0_fixes
used elif rather than lots of ifs in parsing scripts, handle collection_location parsing/matching better and include all linked assemblies
Don't upload to Higlass in full test

Change to same container as other requests module

One less container to fetch; have tested

remove duplicate container directive

first directive is overwritten by second one, have tested that 2nd is correct! :)

increase default memory for POPULATE_TEMPLATE

With 50MB I was having it fail and re-try
changes required as no longer have params.species
No longer have params.species so need to set value in meta correctly
Removed unnecessary metadata params and added checking of params provided
Don't output higlass link file - url now added to parameter files and GN document when applicable
add in percent assembled from goat
added alt_hap_accession to the set of parameters returned
Update Higlass view config and add url to set of data to be passed to the genomenote template
Ensure correct biosample accessions are set and check for "United Kingdom" in collection location
Removed kingdom variable as it's not used directly
Added BUSCO data, fixed rounding issues and replaced 'tissue type' with 'organism part' for consistency across metadata sources
pre-process collection location to have same format across resources
Fixed rounding issues on genome/chr length
Rely on GBIF to provide correct Taxonomic authority information

Merge pull request #95 from sanger-tol/new_release

Documentation updates for the release
Defensive programming: make sure all the variables match
Make it clear what we remove and why
bugfix: the extension has to be removed even if there is no _T1 suffix
"sample" is a sample name, not a path

Found a way to have the test config in the same place

This solves an issue with profile evaluation in Nextflow. The previous syntax
caused Nextflow to ignore the "withName: BUSCO" of conf/base.config in test
mode.

changes to allow metadata collected by the GENOME_STATISTICS subworkflow to be combined with metadata from the GENOME_METADATA subworkflow. This combined data then gets used to fill in the genome note template.
Maximise the amounte of metadata passed through to genome note template
pass through genbank accession for each chr to include in table 2
changes to maximise the amount of meta data passed through to the genome note template

Hotfixes for production
Properly list the new parameter section in the schema

Introduced the "use_work_dir_as_temp" parameter

It defaults to false, meaning no change for users. We can explicitly turn it on for the tol farm

Added Guoying to the author list

by alphabetical order
Both EditorConfig and Prettier want to lint CITATION.cff differently. I want Prettier
Fixed the URLs since we don't need to use absolute URLs any more
Both FastK and MerquryFK need `-P.` to avoid polluting /tmp
Make sure the temporary files are created locally rather than in /tmp
Take 100M out for the various overheads
More trace fields to be able to optimise the parameters later
Reduced a few CPU requirements that were unnecessary high
Increased a few more memory requirements that were too low
Changed way we get the chromosome number
Both FastK and MerquryFK need `-P.` to avoid polluting /tmp

Everything should be increasing the number of CPUs with a log function

The default multiplication rule is too greedy
Indentation should be a multiple of 4
First stab at defining optimised resource requirements for the pipeline [not tested !]
Make sure the temporary files are created locally rather than in /tmp
Take 100M out for the various overheads
Don't need a complete process for that

Merge pull request #82 from sanger-tol/update_higlass

Configure structure of HiGlass ingress directory
Check that the JSON contains an assembly

Get the BUSCO ODB name from the BUSCO definition file rather than GoaT

The issue with GoaT is that it can only handle assemblies that BTK results and
there are issues retrieving older assemblies.

Since the BUSCO ODBs are related to the taxon, not the assembly, start over
from the BUSCO ODB <-> taxon mapping file, query the NCBI to get the list of
all ancestors of that taxon (which works regardless of the assemblies) and get
the most recent one.
Change contact map results files to have name that matches that used for upload to HiGlass
introduced variables and renamed params to make code easier to maintain
Configure structure of higlass ingress directory

Merge pull request #81 from sanger-tol/update_higlass_mm49

#78 review - as commits
Should be using `assembly` directly, since it is a parameter of the module

This module doesn't support Conda

Note that the test is now in the `script` section, following the recent changes
in nf-core: https://github.com/nf-core/modules/issues/3683
Do the copy to the loading folder from within the module
Should be a different variable name not to overwrite the previous meta

The `replace` in conf/modules.config only affects the last extension

This means we need to use "baseName" rather than "simpleName". It makes a
difference if there are multiple dots in the file name.

For instance, "a.b.bedpe" will be published as "a.b.genome" by Nextflow, but
the "simpleName" transformation would make "a.genome".

`.getBaseName()` is the same as `.baseName`.
map is superfluous, the channels are already well formed
These two parameters should be set to false by default, so that everyone (even non Sanger people) can test the pipeline without modification
